page.title: 04A Walk down King St.,Whalley
page.content: The cenotaph and{Old Grammar School mark the northern end of{King Street. { }Heading southwards down the{Old Rope {Walk,}you pass the village chemist and the health centre on the right and the {Methodist Church}on your left. Approaching the zebra crossing you will notice a row of long established {shops}-Whittakers & Sumners favourites of the local children. Passing the bus station on your left you reach the old{Town Gate,}marked by traffic lights still the site of the 4 village pubs. Here you may turn left up Accrington Rd. but straight on you pass a row of {craft,antique}and{gift shops}luring tourists from the car park opposite. And on to the bridge carrying the road over the{River Calder}with its view upstream of the weir and down- stream the{Abbey}and{Railway Viaduct.
